summary:
The Security Council:

* Welcomes the Secretary-General's intention to deploy 80% of UNAMID by December 31, 2008, and urges all stakeholders to facilitate this (para 4).
* Demands the Government of Sudan comply with the Status of Forces Agreement and ensure UNAMID's security and freedom of movement (para 5).
* Underlines the need for enhanced guidelines and information-sharing to strengthen cooperation with troop and police contributors (para 6).
* Urges UNAMID to make full use of its mandate to protect civilians, ensure humanitarian access, and work with other UN agencies (para 7).
* Condemns attacks on UNAMID, demands no recurrence, and requests the Secretary-General to report on investigations and recommendations (para 8).
* Reiterates there can be no military solution to the Darfur conflict, and an inclusive political settlement and UNAMID deployment are essential (para 9).
* Welcomes the appointment of Mr. Djibrill Yipènè Bassolé as Joint AU-UN Chief Mediator and calls on parties to engage in the peace process (para 10).
* Demands an end to violence, attacks on civilians, peacekeepers, and humanitarian personnel, and other human rights and humanitarian law violations (para 11).
* Calls on Sudan and Chad to abide by their obligations under the Dakar and Tripoli Agreements (para 12).
* Demands full implementation of the Communiqué on Facilitation of Humanitarian Activities in Darfur and ensures full, safe, and unhindered access to humanitarian organizations (para 13).
* Requests the Secretary-General to monitor and report on the situation of children and dialogue with parties to end child soldier recruitment (para 14).
* Demands parties protect civilians, including women and children, from sexual violence (para 15).
* Requests the Secretary-General to report every 60 days on developments, compliance, and implementation (para 17).
* Reiterates readiness to take action against parties that impede the peace process, humanitarian assistance, or UNAMID deployment (para 18).
* Decides to remain seized of the matter (para 19).
